Hotel Pennsylvania
5.9 Review score
Based on 1263 reviews

Walking into the spectacular lobby, we thought our room must be of a minimum standard as per the photos.

The hotel was in a great location! I was quite disappointed with the room. I had seen the photos before hand so already knew it wasnt going to be an incredible room- especially in New York on New Years Eve. However at the amount paid for 5 nights I expected some form of quality, i.e clean and safe. Some of the plugs and light switches sparked when turned on and there was a heap of static in the air which was a little concerning. One of the walls looked like someone had thrown coke all over it and it hadnt been cleaned, just had a grubby look to it. The beds were made nicely and staff were friendly. Our room didnt get made up one day at all, we had been out all day and when we got back it was still as we left it but we were too tired to go out again and have the staff finish it. If the hotel cleaned the rooms a little better and invested some money into improving the rooms as can clearly be seen in the lobby it would improve future experiences!

Show more
Rebekah , Australia
The Wyndham New Yorker Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 773 reviews

The fantastic location (next to Penn Station) is irrefutable. The history of the hotel itself makes the stay more enriching.

However, there are quite a number of disappointments that I would like to highlight. 1) There is no kettle in the hotel and visitors with a weak stomach or would like to have a glass of warm water for their medicine will have to bear with cold tap water or mineral water. 2) There is neither slipper nor toothbrush. Visitors will have to get them from the 7-11 store down the street. 3) As this hotel is undergoing some renovation during the day, visitors on jet lag will have difficulties taking an afternoon nap because of the drilling sound. 4) There is an astonishing USD30 facility fee per day which is not informed to visitor upon booking through agoda. Personally, I felt that this is unfair for other hotels and customers because not all hotels in NYC impose a facility fee. If I know that there is a USD30 facility fee per day for my 7-day stay, I would not choose this hotel. 5) There is no other facility apart from the gym. There is a coin laundry room but visitors are not allowed to use. Only students staying in the hotel on a long-term basis are allowed to use. 6) The room is rather small for a 4 or 5 star hotel. All in all, I think The New Yorker is leveraging on its location, totally falling short in terms of services as a 4 / 5 star hotel. This leaves a bad taste on customers' mouth, especially given that Wyndham has other hotels in other cities. As a result of my less than satisfactory experience in this hotel, I will never stay in other Wyndham in other cities ever again.

Show more
Khang , Malaysia
Night Hotel Times Square
7.5 Very good
Based on 290 reviews

Our stay started with a set of dirty sheets that had something I had to srap off. Disgusting! When we called the front desk to have them changed they sent someone us who handed us the sheets and told us we would have to change the linen ourselves.

We booked a quuen bed and this is not what we received. I am 5'5 and my feet nearly hung off the end of the bed. My husband is not large either and he hit his elbow on the nightstand in the middle of the night because the bed was so small and the night stand was shoved up against it. We paid for 2 nights and we feel we did not get our moneys worth by any means. I forgot we also found what looked to be a part of a syringe on the bathroom floor. It was evident this room had not been cleaned well. My husband called ahead of time to arrange something special in our room for my birthday when we arrived. Nothing was ever done. This hotel was a complete disaster. The lobby and bar may be nice and that is where the charm stops. DO NOT STAY here! The free wi fi is only in the lobby and it is slow! If we had not prepaid for this room we would have not stayed and gone to another hotel. We feel ripped off!

Show more
Chris , United States
Wellington Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 396 reviews

I titled my review in a way that shows I am not an experienced traveler when it comes to NY. I just want to keep things in the proper perspective.

Pros: Excellent staff at the reception desk and the bellman station. Room very clean, and the climate control system fine. Noise within the hotel almost completely undetectable - - a nice surprise. TV with lots of cable stations available was very good. Bed was excellent. Cons: Room was somewhat of a tight squeeze, but I understand the space premium is very high in NY; to be clear, it was not uncomfortable, but it begged for a bit more breathing room. Maid did not speak English (she was Polish, and a delight otherwise). Noise from the street was significant despite my being on the 17th floor, but it did disappear after midnight. Shower good, but again a tight fit. Water flow in the sink was very low, and controlling the water temperature almost impossible, i.e., you get either cold or blistering hot water, but not much in-between. Overall, a more than acceptable accommodation in a very good city location.

Show more
Achille , United States
Shoreham Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 47 reviews

Arlo SoHo
8.8 Excellent
Based on 32 reviews

The Watson Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 65 reviews

I decided to book this hotel because I wanted to rest before an exam. The hotel was dirty; the carpets were filthy; the toilet did not work; and to top it off there were scaffolds right outside my window.

I had a horrible nights sleep. There was construction going on. It was a waste of my money for this outdated and broken down hotel that is in need of serious renovation. When I checked out of the hotel and turned in my room cards, the front desk receptionist had asked me "How was my stay". I replied politely and honestly that my stay was not pleasant. The employee smirked and did not say anything after that. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone in this area. I would have preferred to pay a little more extra for any other hotel in the area. Thank you very much!

Show more
Peter , United States
NOMO SOHO Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 81 reviews

It was excellent, and I have a lot to say about The Mondrian that is positive. However, it is also helpful to you to give you some honest criticism to point out where you could improve.

The bartender at the indoor bar (behind the concierge desk) was very professional, and made great drinks. But... when you pay $16.00 for a glass of wine, the very least a bar can do is to provide some complimentary nibbles, such as nuts or crisps. This ought to be de rigueur. Second, the coffee I got at the bar in the atrium restaurant on Monday morning took WAY too long to make and to pay for. And it was THE MOST EXPENSIVE COFFEE IN THE WORLD at almost $7.00 (that's for a friggin' cup of coffee, it ain't champagne!). The scent that permeates the lobby is nice, but it can be a little cloying after a while and some people may not want that much fragrance up in their face. Finally, I was denied free access to the roof terrace on Sunday night because there was a DJ event -- again, when you pay a lot to stay at a hotel you would expect that entrance to the hotel's own roof terrace on ANY night, regardless of events, would be standard. Thanks for a lovely stay and I hope that these comments will help you to keep and to attract more happy customers.

Show more
T , United States
Hotel Stanford
7.9 Very good
Based on 439 reviews

Summary - If you want an affordable room which is centrally located then this is the hotel for you. (My g'f is usually quite picky and wanted a clean hotel and this hotel satisfied her needs) Room- It was a decent size for a NY hotel, it's a bit dated though still very clean.

Our room had no view, but we didn't really care. Beds are neither hard nor soft,but comfortable. Safe inside. Free wifi. Location - It's approx. ~30m-40mins from JFK. Best to catch a taxi as it is a fixed rate about $55usd -It is located in Korea town. -Close to Penn station which is a main subway station that links you to all the main attractions.The subways are pretty good (though old and dirty) so you can catch a train to most attractions. -Walking distance to Macys - 5mins, Victoria secret - 5mins, Timesquare - 15mins, Empire state building -10mins, Madison Square garden 13mins. Breakfast - Simple and ok - Bagels are probably the best thing there, the pastry stuff is ok, nothing great. We tended to go "Speedy Cafe/deli?" which is just down the street on the corner. Value- Good value for a hotel which is located in a great location Cons - Yes the exhaust fan is loud though that didn't really bother us but some may be picky. -Yes there is a single elevator but we are on holiday so whats the rush?.

Show more
Allan , Australia
Gansevoort Park Avenue NYC
8.8 Excellent
Based on 54 reviews

I booked Gansevoort Park Avenue NYC primarily due to the rooftop pool. Thursday I was able to get a sun lounger, and it was a nice relaxing atmosphere.

Friday and Saturday I got the last day bed available, it was packed. Children splashing around in the pool and throwing these stupid silver inflatable balls around that the hotel provides which was really annoying. One of the balls hit a lady who was reading a book and trying to relax on a sunbed. I was horrified when the couple sitting next to me in the undercover area lit up cigarettes! I can't believe the hotel permit smoking up there, especially within the indoor section. It's a nice area, and the vibe I think they are going for is relaxed, good music playing, but with kids making noise and taking over the pool, it ruins it. They should make the pool area adults only (18 years +), and definitely make it non-smoking. A 2nd pool area next level up (above bar area) for adults only would be ideal.

Show more
Alison , Australia
Park Central Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 176 reviews

The hotel was in a great location, just a 5 minute walk to Central Park or TImes Square but quite quiet as well.

There is a subway stop on the corner. The receptionist on check in was OK, we'd booked a king and she tried to give up a double queen room but having held out ground she grudgingly found one. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom very small. The Central Market on site was convenient for quick breakfast supplies and run but the coffee was poor and all was expensive even by New York standards so we used delis on our way which also varied in price and quality (we don't recommend the nearest which was the Premier Deli).

Show more
Mary , United Kingdom
The Mansfield Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 37 reviews

Admittedly, the room was small! But, when we arrived at 10:30 a.m., after starting our day at 4 a.m., we were thrilled to have a comfortable, clean bed to nap in for an hour before we began our trek around the city.

There was a small closet to hang things in, but there was a refrigerator in the bottom (with expensive snacks) so there was no where to put our bags. Literally, we had a bed and one chair, a flat screened tv, and sort of a bay window arrangement where we could put our suitcases. Lighting was a bit strange, too. To offset this, though, bathroom was spotless, and so was the room. We slept like babies and were in a very quiet room. The hotel is located ideally if you are in New York for shows. Subway not too far away. On the Sunday when we were there, there was a 10 block street fair (no traffic) on 6th Avenue, which was fun. Really liked the food (especially breakfast) and would consider going back again in the future.

Show more
Barbara , United States
Distrikt Hotel New York City
7.7 Very good
Based on 26 reviews

Dream Downtown Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 106 reviews

I checked in to Dream on the Sunday but was not happy with the size of the standard room, was to small for me.

I called the front desk to see if any other rooms were available and they offered to show me some alternatives. The Front Desk Manager\showed me other options and was extremely helpful in moving me to a room that suited me. Good size room with direct access to the pool, Cherry restaurant downstairs is really good one of my favourite in NYC. Good location right next door to TAO. I was however disappointed with the staff at the door for PHD, to summarise... they were rude, arrogant and paid little attention to people except the ones they knew. At one point it took the guy at the door to acknowledge I was there even though I was the only one in the queue. if only they had the same attitude as the front desk staff..... but I guess thats asking to much of the pretentious nature of people at club doors.

Show more
Amjad , United States
Fifty NYC-an Affinia Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 123 reviews

I stayed in this hotel for one night at the tail end of a vacation trip to New York with friends. I booked the basic twin room but was pleasantly surprised to find upon entering that I was upgraded to a corner suite with two big TV's and a kitchen/pantry section.

I was able to chat a bit with the manager while in the elevator and he mentioned that a lot of the rooms in the hotel were suites so there was a relatively good chance to get upgraded once in a while. One thing I noticed was that the bathroom had a strange layout. It was quite large, but the shower itself was very small, tucked in a corner, and didn't have its own light (so it was dark when the shower curtain was closed). Otherwise, it was a nice, big unit. It was definitely better than I expected, but nothing mind-blowing. The service was great. The front desk staff were friendly despite there being a lot of other guests checking in/out at the same time as me. The other staff in the main lobby always greeted me upon arrival and were quite helpful in giving directions. Some of the lights and appliances in my room weren't working when I checked in, but someone came up and solved the issue shortly after I called it in. I will definitely consider staying here again the next time I visit New York.

Show more
John , Philippines
Iberostar 70 Park Avenue
8.2 Excellent
Based on 13 reviews

The Court - A St Giles Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 197 reviews

First Room: I COULD NOT reenter the first room that I was given, because the battery in the door lock expired.

I waited outside the room for 15 minutes, while my belonging was inside. In addition, I went to the front desk twice for “new” keys, until one of the staff realized that the battery expired (versus a door key issue). I moved all my belongings myself to the second room, in order to expedite the move. Second Room: I was upgraded to a suite thereafter. Although the suite was spacious, drops of water was dripping from the bedroom’s ceiling (on top of the bedroom window). I could hear the drops throughout the night. I DID NOT want to move rooms again, therefore I chose to sleep in the couch in the living room.

Show more
Wallace , United States
Ace Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 298 reviews

We had a great time. We arrived at about 1am and the place was still vibrant with people, fun and drinks at the bar.

Checking in was easy and although the place was fully booked out, we still got a room with great views of the empire state! We went back down for a quick drink and the bar had a great selection on offer and late night snacks for hungry travellers. In the morning we realised just how truly fantastic the place is. Outside of appreciating the funky décor, make the most of the breakfast in the restaurant down stairs and the COFFEE IS TO DIE FOR! The place is really close to all the best things on offer in NYC shopping, eating, sites etc. It is also really close to the subway and taxi's are always parked out the front. Make sure you have some champagne and oysters downstairs in the afternoon. Overall, I would definitely stay here again!

Show more
Paul , Australia
Tryp by Wyndham Times Square South
8.3 Excellent
Based on 357 reviews

Location: The Tryp hotel was a great place to stay in, it around 1 mile away from times square and 1.

6 miles from central park so there isn't much of a need of a taxi or public transportation when you're there, besides, you get to see a lot of interesting places if you're walking. I'm not saying that there isn't any public transportation in the area, a metro is a minute away from the hotel and Penn Station is 5 minutes away, also if you want a taxi just walk down the street and you'll find the famous yellow cabs everywhere you look. The Room: The rooms in the hotel are clean and for the room I stayed in (Deluxe queen) it was big enough for two persons with a nice bathroom that has a shower not a tub. The bed was quite comfortable to sleep in and the lighting was very relaxing and nice, and with two windows there was enough sunlight in the day to light the room. Although the view wasn't much, we did get a room on the 9th floor (as requested when I booked it. One thing that bothered me about the room is that the walls seem to be paper thin, we could hear our neighbors as if they were with us in the same room. Staff: The staff were very friendly and greeted us with smiles on their faces when we checked in and out, other than that I didn't interact with them as much.

Show more
Moayad , United States
Avalon Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 116 reviews

We didn't get off to the best start. I was travelling with my sister over NYE and had booked this hotel over others for two reasons.

.. 1 they seemed more spacious than other hotels in the area and 2. we wanted a room with two beds, which this hotel offered at a reasonable price compared to others. The room we booked was called a "Junior 2 Double Beds Suite". When we arrived, it seemed that having noticed the room was only booked for two, the staff made the assumption that we were a couple and put us in a room with one bed. The staff was not exactly disagreeable when we brought this to their attention, but also weren't very apologetic. They chose to emphasise that the different room wasn't a downgrade and that the junior suite is available as two types of rooms, rather than simply apologising (when clearly the booking stated "2 doubles") and searching for a solution. Ultimately, we spent the first night with one of us on a sofa and were moved to a room with two beds the next day. Rather reluctantly, the staff also gave us complimentary breakfast for the first day when we requested it, but still remained adamant that the mixup was not the fault of the hotel's but rather our mistake (again... "Junior 2 Double Beds Suite"). Once this had passed however, our stay was quite enjoyable. The staff varied in degrees of friendliness but the rooms were clean and comfortable. The shower pressure could have been better, but it could have been worse and ultimately we were quite happy with our decision to stay there. Hotel Tip: If you are booking a room for 2 with the same or a similar situation to ours, it may be worth making the situation clear in the special requests section of the booking in order to avoid confusion upon arrival.

Show more
Bradley , Australia
The Benjamin Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 27 reviews

We had a wonderful stay at The Benjamin. From start to finish everything was impeccable. It was very busy in the area with the U.

N. in session and President Obama attending but The Benjamin and their staff made any inconveniences hardly noticeable. The staff were all very cordial and helpful from our greeting at the door, to our bellman, the front desk and also the concierge. We have stayed here before and love the new updated design of the rooms. It makes the rooms feel larger and brighter. We also love the comfort of the bed and duvet. And thank you to The Benjamin for the extra touch waiting for us in our room upon arrival...it made my wife's birthday and our anniversary very special. We will be back soon.

Show more
Donald , United States
Hotel The OUT NYC
7.7 Very good
Based on 143 reviews

I was worried at first because I heard horror stories about noise and the club located next door but we had a very peaceful and pleasurable stay at The Out.

The staff was very friendly, personable and helpful. We stayed Sunday and left the following Friday afternoon so I think we avoided the ''party' crowd. We requested a quiet room and they were happy to accommodate. The room was amazing. It even had a moon roof you could open and close automatically. It is a hotel geared more toward the gay crowd, which we had no problem with at all. We brought our 9 year old daughter and she loved the hotel too. When they say 'hetero-friendly' they mean it. The decor was very modern and unique and the courtyards were a great place to relax and unwind. Love, love, love this hotel! We would definitely stay there again....but not on a weekend.

Show more
Douglas , United States
Paramount Times Square
7 Very good
Based on 85 reviews

1) The Hotel stated that my room has a Queen size bed for 2 occupants. Unfortunately when we got our keys and entered our room, we were shocked to discover that our bed is smaller than a Queen size.

The size of our room so small that if we place 2 luggage on the floor, we are not able to move around. 2) The air-conditioner is very noisy. I can't be sleeping at the lobby. Hence, I had to roam around NYC like a zombie. 5) The floor/carpet is super filthy. Whenever I walked barefeet, I noticed my feet will black and filthy because of the dust and dirt. You dont wanna place your items on the floor. 6) The hotel has more than 3 elevators. No note was left to state if the concierge is away for a short while or something. Initially I enquired from the Reception staff for some general directions or enquiries. Unfortunately , the reception staff told me to ask from the concierge instead. 7 Very good

The location for this hotel is almost ideal for the budget traveler to access Manhattan. Priced way lower than the premium rates in the city, it is still clean, quiet and comfortable accommodation.

But there is some potential going begging... Long Island City doesn't have the cachet of Manhattan nor the street views. But the locality around this hotel is being nicely redeveloped just now, with new hotels, shops, offices and dining opening nearby. And with three separate Metro (subway) stations within a few blocks strolling range, access to midtown takes one ride of only a couple of stops. For value access to NY, the location cannot be beaten. So the potential for this hotel is good and should be growing. Alas, while the basics of quiet, clean, comfortable rooms are covered, they does seem to be missing some tricks. For example, the breakfast arrangements are limited and messy and do not cater at all well with the morning rush. Be early, or wait in line for a table! The in-house wifi is way under-equipped for a multi-storey hotel. If you get a connection, you are lucky; if it stays connected, luckier still. It would be a good idea if the desk staff actually knew about local dining and transport options currently available within half a mile of their own hotel. I'm sure these businesses would definitely appreciate any added trade going their way, and there are some very good options going, even a chic restaurant with an art gallery. A local area street map available at the front desk would also be very helpful. Finally, the ice-machine (at least on level 3) is a definite minus. The compressor is so noisy that its vibrations wake the residents in the adjacent rooms regularly. It should really be replaced with vending machines of something, and confined to the dining room only. Summary: If you want a quiet, clean location at a budget price with convenient access to NY, this is it. But there is definitely room for improvement in a number of areas.

Li Kim ,Malaysia

For the best experience, travel as the locals do - on the subways. I have been in New York City before and it was exhausting because I drove into the city.

Finding a parking space is possible but it is very expensive and can be quite hard to find. The last two times, We bought an unlimited metro pass for the week, which includes both the trains and buses. We also rented a car so that we could drive out of the city into the mountains to see the beautiful fall colors. However, it took 1 1/2 hours to get 13 miles because of the massive traffic so the car stayed parked most of the time. The subway made my travels part of the experience, instead of a headache to endure. No trip would be complete without going to Grand Central Station, this renovated building is definately magnificent. We visited Central Park (over 800 acres) and Prospect Park (Brooklyn - over 400 acres). Both very beautiful and huge parks that give a wide variety of things to do and experiences to enjoy. I loved the horse & carriage ride, the pedicab tour and the time spent just walking through the parks. We enjoyed the waterfront parks and walked across the Brooklyn Bridge. We also attended a couple of Broadway shows. Take the boat to Liberty and Ellis Islands and enjoy learning about the history of the many immigrants to our country. I spent time researching and finding the passage documents for my grandparents and great grandparents who came from Europe. Take the train out to Coney Island and enjoy the beach, the amusement park and, of course, Nathans original hot dog restaurant. The shopping was fun and something for all different budgets. We ate somewhere new each night and had a wonderful variety of food available for every budget. However, the best part was the people. They were so friendly and every time that we even looked like we might not know where we were, there was magically someone there asking if they could help us.

More about New York (NY)

New York City is one of most diverse communities in the world, speaking as many as 800 languages amongst the more than eight million citizens. Since it was established as a Dutch trading post, New York City has attracted immigrants from the world over, and today, it reflects the character and spirit of the grand mixture of ethnicities in what is now a global power city.

Millions of people flock to New York City every year to experience its liveliness, success, and splendor. Times Square is certainly one of the most iconic areas to visit. The Broadway theaters have also made a name for themselves and provide an excellent celebration of art and culture. Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty have welcomed many who have planted their roots in the city and beyond, and they continue to draw new arrivals and visitors every year.

Being such a high profile city, New York hosts many grand events, including the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade and the lighting of the Rockefeller Christmas Tree. Luxury shopping is best found around Fifth and Madison Avenue, and bargain shopping can be found all around. Dining also ranges from corner pizza joints to high-end dining establishments, both being appetizing and satisfying.

The hotel was in a great location! I was quite disappointed with the room. I had seen the photos before hand so already knew it wasnt going to be an incredible room- especially in New York on New Years Eve. However at the amount paid for 5 nights I expected some form of quality, i.e clean and safe. Some of the plugs and light switches sparked when turned on and there was a heap of static in the air which was a little concerning. One of the walls looked like someone had thrown coke all over it and it hadnt been cleaned, just had a grubby look to it. The beds were made nicely and staff were friendly. Our room didnt get made up one day at all, we had been out all day and when we got back it was still as we left it but we were too tired to go out again and have the staff finish it. If the hotel cleaned the rooms a little better and invested some money into improving the rooms as can clearly be seen in the lobby it would improve future experiences! Show more Rebekah , Australia The Wyndham New Yorker Hotel 7.4 Very good Based on 773 reviews The fantastic location (next to Penn Station) is irrefutable. The history of the hotel itself makes the stay more enriching. However, there are quite a number of disappointments that I would like to highlight. 1) There is no kettle in the hotel and visitors with a weak stomach or would like to have a glass of warm water for their medicine will have to bear with cold tap water or mineral water. 2) There is neither slipper nor toothbrush. Visitors will have to get them from the 7-11 store down the street. 3) As this hotel is undergoing some renovation during the day, visitors on jet lag will have difficulties taking an afternoon nap because of the drilling sound. 4) There is an astonishing USD30 facility fee per day which is not informed to visitor upon booking through agoda. Personally, I felt that this is unfair for other hotels and customers because not all hotels in NYC impose a facility fee. If I know that there is a USD30 facility fee per day for my 7-day stay, I would not choose this hotel. 5) There is no other facility apart from the gym. There is a coin laundry room but visitors are not allowed to use. Only students staying in the hotel on a long-term basis are allowed to use. 6) The room is rather small for a 4 or 5 star hotel. All in all, I think The New Yorker is leveraging on its location, totally falling short in terms of services as a 4 / 5 star hotel. This leaves a bad taste on customers' mouth, especially given that Wyndham has other hotels in other cities. As a result of my less than satisfactory experience in this hotel, I will never stay in other Wyndham in other cities ever again. When we called the front desk to have them changed they sent someone us who handed us the sheets and told us we would have to change the linen ourselves. It was evident this room had not been cleaned well. My husband called ahead of time to arrange something special in our room for my birthday when we arrived. Nothing was ever done. This hotel was a complete disaster. The lobby and bar may be nice and that is where the charm stops. DO NOT STAY here! The free wi fi is only in the lobby and it is slow! Noise within the hotel almost completely undetectable - - a nice surprise. TV with lots of cable stations available was very good. Bed was excellent. Cons: Room was somewhat of a tight squeeze, but I understand the space premium is very high in NY; to be clear, it was not uncomfortable, but it begged for a bit more breathing room. Show more Moayad , United States Avalon Hotel 8.2 Excellent Based on 116 reviews We didn't get off to the best start. I was travelling with my sister over NYE and had booked this hotel over others for two reasons. .. 1 they seemed more spacious than other hotels in the area and 2. we wanted a room with two beds, which this hotel offered at a reasonable price compared to others. The room we booked was called a "Junior 2 Double Beds Suite". When we arrived, it seemed that having noticed the room was only booked for two, the staff made the assumption that we were a couple and put us in a room with one bed. The staff was not exactly disagreeable when we brought this to their attention, but also weren't very apologetic. They chose to emphasise that the different room wasn't a downgrade and that the junior suite is available as two types of rooms, rather than simply apologising (when clearly the booking stated "2 doubles") and searching for a solution. Ultimately, we spent the first night with one of us on a sofa and were moved to a room with two beds the next day. Rather reluctantly, the staff also gave us complimentary breakfast for the first day when we requested it, but still remained adamant that the mixup was not the fault of the hotel's but rather our mistake (again... "Junior 2 Double Beds Suite"). Once this had passed however, our stay was quite enjoyable. The staff varied in degrees of friendliness but the rooms were clean and comfortable. The shower pressure could have been better, but it could have been worse and ultimately we were quite happy with our decision to stay there. It's a very recommended hotel on budget Show more Arif , Indonesia Country Inn & Suites Long Island City 7 Very good Based on 336 reviews The location for this hotel is almost ideal for the budget traveler to access Manhattan. Priced way lower than the premium rates in the city, it is still clean, quiet and comfortable accommodation. But there is some potential going begging... Long Island City doesn't have the cachet of Manhattan nor the street views. But the locality around this hotel is being nicely redeveloped just now, with new hotels, shops, offices and dining opening nearby. And with three separate Metro (subway) stations within a few blocks strolling range, access to midtown takes one ride of only a couple of stops. For value access to NY, the location cannot be beaten. So the potential for this hotel is good and should be growing. Alas, while the basics of quiet, clean, comfortable rooms are covered, they does seem to be missing some tricks. For example, the breakfast arrangements are limited and messy and do not cater at all well with the morning rush. Be early, or wait in line for a table! The in-house wifi is way under-equipped for a multi-storey hotel. If you get a connection, you are lucky; if it stays connected, luckier still. It would be a good idea if the desk staff actually knew about local dining and transport options currently available within half a mile of their own hotel. I'm sure these businesses would definitely appreciate any added trade going their way, and there are some very good options going, even a chic restaurant with an art gallery. A local area street map available at the front desk would also be very helpful. Finally, the ice-machine (at least on level 3) is a definite minus. The compressor is so noisy that its vibrations wake the residents in the adjacent rooms regularly. It should really be replaced with vending machines of something, and confined to the dining room only. Summary: If you want a quiet, clean location at a budget price with convenient access to NY, this is it. But there is definitely room for improvement in a number of areas. Show more Li Kim ,Malaysia For the best experience, travel as the locals do - on the subways. I have been in New York City before and it was exhausting because I drove into the city. Finding a parking space is possible but it is very expensive and can be quite hard to find. The last two times, We bought an unlimited metro pass for the week, which includes both the trains and buses. We also rented a car so that we could drive out of the city into the mountains to see the beautiful fall colors. However, it took 1 1/2 hours to get 13 miles because of the massive traffic so the car stayed parked most of the time. The subway made my travels part of the experience, instead of a headache to endure. No trip would be complete without going to Grand Central Station, this renovated building is definately magnificent. We visited Central Park (over 800 acres) and Prospect Park (Brooklyn - over 400 acres). Both very beautiful and huge parks that give a wide variety of things to do and experiences to enjoy. I loved the horse & carriage ride, the pedicab tour and the time spent just walking through the parks. We enjoyed the waterfront parks and walked across the Brooklyn Bridge. We also attended a couple of Broadway shows. Take the boat to Liberty and Ellis Islands and enjoy learning about the history of the many immigrants to our country. I spent time researching and finding the passage documents for my grandparents and great grandparents who came from Europe. Take the train out to Coney Island and enjoy the beach, the amusement park and, of course, Nathans original hot dog restaurant. The shopping was fun and something for all different budgets. We ate somewhere new each night and had a wonderful variety of food available for every budget. However, the best part was the people. They were so friendly and every time that we even looked like we might not know where we were, there was magically someone there asking if they could help us. Kennedy International Airport 135 hotels Financial District 124 hotels LaGuardia Airport 122 hotels Long Island City 48 hotels Bronx 41 hotels Queens 37 hotels Staten Island 25 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Hostels in New York (NY) 35 More about New York (NY) New York City is one of most diverse communities in the world, speaking as many as 800 languages amongst the more than eight million citizens. Since it was established as a Dutch trading post, New York City has attracted immigrants from the world over, and today, it reflects the character and spirit of the grand mixture of ethnicities in what is now a global power city. Millions of people flock to New York City every year to experience its liveliness, success, and splendor. Times Square is certainly one of the most iconic areas to visit. The Broadway theaters have also made a name for themselves and provide an excellent celebration of art and culture. Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty have welcomed many who have planted their roots in the city and beyond, and they continue to draw new arrivals and visitors every year. Being such a high profile city, New York hosts many grand events, including the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade and the lighting of the Rockefeller Christmas Tree. Luxury shopping is best found around Fifth and Madison Avenue, and bargain shopping can be found all around. Dining also ranges from corner pizza joints to high-end dining establishments, both being appetizing and satisfying.
